page.title: 04Halsway Manor and Mews
page.content: {Halsway Manor}lies between the {Brendon}and{Quantock}hills in 10 acres of garden and woodland. This fine mansion,built of local red sandstone has battlements and gargoyles and resident ghosts. Although Halsway spans more than 9 centuries only a little of a{Tudor} house can be traced as it has been much altered over the years. The cellars,and the library with its dark and beautifully carved panels are the oldest parts. Tradition says that {Cardinal Beaufort}used it as a{Hunting {Lodge.}Years later it was sold to pay off a ransom to a Breton Pirate. After being a farmhouse it fell into disrepair. The{Halsway Society}bought it 21 years ago and in 1982 the original stables were reunited with the Manor and formed {The Mews.
